definition: lit. a banquet with no empty seats/full house/capacity crowd/standing room only
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc

sentences.english: But after the film opened there last week, theater operators said their houses were packed.
sentences.chinese: 但自上週該電影在那裏首映後，電影院均稱座無虛席。

sentences.english: The ground was packed out when our local team played its League Cup match.
sentences.chinese: 當我們本地的球隊爭奪聯賽盃時，場內座無虛席。

sentences.english: Soon the Belk Theater was packed.
sentences.chinese: 不久，貝爾克劇場就座無虛席。

sentences.english: Eyewitnesses said the baggage hall was packed.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者表示，行李提取區內座無虛席。

sentences.english: Full house and flush payoffs are different, but the strategy is roughly the same.
sentences.chinese: 座無虛席，刷新收益是不同的，但是戰略是大致相同。

sentences.english: The lecture attracted many students of South China University of Technology.
sentences.chinese: 講座吸引了華南理工大學的莘莘學子，座無虛席。

definition: meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
filled to capacity (of theater, stadium, gymnasium etc)
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
joy of first experience (idiom)/the pleasure of reading sth for the first time
to get together all at once
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
